message_1: What is the isotope notation and identification of carbon-14?
message_2: The isotope notation of carbon-14 is written as ¹⁴C or C-14. Carbon-14 is an isotope of carbon with 6 protons and 8 neutrons in its nucleus, giving it an atomic mass of 14. It is a radioactive isotope, commonly used in radiocarbon dating and other scientific applications.
